{"id":528477100,"lang":"python3","time":"1 week, 1 day","timestamp":1627286438,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"92 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/528477100/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Median of Two Sorted Arrays","memory":"14.5 MB","code":"from typing import List\n\nclass Solution:\n    def findMedianSortedArrays(self,A, B):\n        m, n = len(A), len(B)\n        if m > n:\n            A, B, m, n = B, A, n, m\n        if n == 0:\n            raise ValueError\n\n        imin, imax, half_len = 0, m, (m + n + 1) // 2\n        while imin <= imax:\n            i = (imin + imax) // 2\n            j = half_len - i\n            if i < m and B[j-1] > A[i]:\n                # i is too small, must increase it\n                imin = i + 1\n            elif i > 0 and A[i-1] > B[j]:\n                # i is too big, must decrease it\n                imax = i - 1\n            else:\n                # i is perfect\n\n                if i == 0: max_of_left = B[j-1]\n                elif j == 0: max_of_left = A[i-1]\n                else: max_of_left = max(A[i-1], B[j-1])\n\n                if (m + n) % 2 == 1:\n                    return max_of_left\n\n                if i == m: min_of_right = B[j]\n                elif j == n: min_of_right = A[i]\n                else: min_of_right = min(A[i], B[j])\n\n                return (max_of_left + min_of_right) / 2.0\n        return -1","compare_result":"","title_slug":"median-of-two-sorted-arrays"}
